form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: United States Department of Justice Immigration and Naturalization Service

full_text: Screened by NARA, 7/7/2023 00 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE DATE: 11/06/94 MARIANO DE JESUS GALLO PADILLA FILE: A73779517 887 W 79 ST HIALEAH FL 33014 PLEASE COME TO THIS OFFICE 7880 BISCAYNE BLVD, RH 490, MIAMI, FL 33138 ON: 03/01/95 AT: 10:00 AM regarding an Immigration matter. Failure to respond to this request may result in denial of your application. BE ON TIME. A late arrival can cause you a long delay or postponement of the interview. EMERGENCY If you must cancel this appointment because of an emergency, please indicate below the nature of the emergency and attach evidence of the emergency Sign and date this form and return it to this office immediately. BRING WITH YOU: This letter; an interpreter (if you do not speak English) all documents listed below (any document in a foreign language must be accompanied by a certified English translation). Documents submitted must be originals or certified copies that bear the seal of the issuing authority. Provide an addi- tional photocopy of any original document you wish returned NOTE: Interview may be video-taped by the Service. BRING YOUR PASSPORT, birth certificate & original entry document (I-94) YOUR SPOUSE MUST APPEAR WITH YOU and bring a valid photo identification issued prior to marriage. Be prepared to present evidence that you and your spouse reside together in a husband/wife relationship birth certificates of children born of your present marriage income tax returns, mortgage documents, insur- ance policies; utility bills, rent receipts, wedding invitations & photographs. CURRENT MEDICAL REPORT: As soon as you receive this notice, you are required to make arrangements for your medical examination with one of the medical examiners on the attached list of INS-approved physicians who will perform the medical examination, required laboratory procedures, and any necessary chest x-ray. NOTE: Applicants 2 years of age or older are required to have a tuberculin skin test (Mantoux) as part of the medical examination followed by a chest x-ray examination if reaction of 5mm or greater. ROUTINELY, APPLICANTS UNDER 15 YEARS OF AGE ARE NOT REQUIRED TO HAVE THE TESTS AS PART OF THEIR MEDICAL EXAMINATION PROOF OF SUPPORT You and/or any employed family members must present from each employer a letter on official stationery that indicates the position, whether the position is temporary or permanent, current salary, and date of initial employment IF YOU HAVE AT ANY TIME BEEN ARRESTED in any country you must submit the following for EACH arrest arresting officer's report; indictment (if applicable); and a document showing the disposition of the case. (Continued on next page)
